content: Sporting event delegation **[Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)** participated in the **[2007 Southeast Asian Games](/wiki/2007_Southeast_Asian_Games)** (SEA) which were held in the city of [Nakhon Ratchasima](/wiki/Nakhon_Ratchasima), [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand) from 6 to 16 December 2007. Singapore won a record 43 gold medals at the SEA Games. ## Participation details Singapore sent a total contingent of 658 to the 2007 SEA Games: of 442 competitors and 216 officials. The largest contingent ever sent to an away games, they participated in 35 of the 45 sports in the games. **Participation and medal targets** SportCompetitorsGold Medal TargetGold Medals in [previous No athletes were fielded for [Baseball](/wiki/Baseball_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), [Boxing](/wiki/Boxing_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), Chess, [Handball](/wiki/Handball_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), Netball, [Tennis](/wiki/Tennis_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), [Traditional boat race](/wiki/Traditional_boat_race_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), [Volleyball](/wiki/Volleyball_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), [Weightlifting](/wiki/Weightlifting_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games) and [Wrestling](/wiki/Wrestling_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games). ## Medals Singapore entered the games expecting a Gold medal hail of between 35 and 45. On 12 December 2007, the target was raised and 42 - 45. Singapore retained pole position in [Swimming](/wiki/Aquatics_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games), despite the absence of [Joscelin Yeo](/wiki/Joscelin_Yeo) who has since retired. 10 of the 22 swimmers were first-timers. In all, they broke four games records, nine national records, four U17 national records, and recorded 26 personal bests. - The [Table tennis](/wiki/Table_tennis_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games) contingent swept all seven gold medals in the sport, the first time Singapore had done so in the SEA games. - The [water polo](/wiki/Aquatics_at_the_2007_Southeast_Asian_Games) team retained their title for the 22nd consecutive time since 1965, despite having eight new members in a team of 13. - Team Singapore 2007 Southeast Asian Games This [SEA Games](/wiki/SEA_Games)-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about sports in Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Singapore at the 2007 SEA Games
